row.column: Integrating Acumatica ERP with External Tax Providers If your organization sells products or provides services in the United States, you need to collect sales taxes and periodically remit them to the appropriate taxing authorities. Generally, the sales tax rate that applies to a particular transaction is determined by the location of the customer and the location of the seller, as well as whether the seller has a significant business presence ( nexus ) in the state of the customer. The sales tax on a transaction is a combination of sales taxes paid to different tax authorities. In addition to the sales tax with the rate defined by the state, local jurisdictions may add various local taxes. There are up to 10,000 tax jurisdictions in the U.S., each with its own tax rates and rules. With this complexity and variation of rules, it can be difficult for most organizations to calculate and manage sales and use taxes. Acumatica ERP gives you the ability to enable automatic calculation of taxes by setting up online integration with the AvaTax service provided by Avalara or another external tax provider. Online integration between Acumatica ERP and an external tax provider gives your organization the following benefits: Real-time calculation of taxes on all transactions Up-to-date tax rates for all tax jurisdictions in the United States Verification of customer addresses for determining the correct tax jurisdiction Management of customer reseller permits and exemption certificates The ability to easily create tax rules and use them for appropriate transactions automatically Filing of tax reports on behalf of each branch that reports separately to each tax authority involved This chapter describes the details of configuring the online integration of Acumatica ERP with Avalara AvaTax. In This Chapter Online Integration with Avalara AvaTaxTo Configure Your AvaTax AccountTo Set Up Integration With AvaTax

Online Integration with Avalara AvaTax If your company sells multiple types of products in many tax jurisdictions, configuring tax calculation and reporting in Acumatica ERP and maintaining up-to-date rates for all the taxes may require too much work and time. In this case, you might consider integrating with the AvaTax service by Avalara and then processing sales and use taxes online by using AvaTax. Because Acumatica ERP provides built-in support for online integration with AvaTax, you can easily set up this integration. The integration involves tasks that should be performed on both sides: in Acumatica ERP and in Avalara AvaTax. Make sure that the External Tax Calculation Integration feature is enabled in your system on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Account Configuration on the Avalara Website You can configure the integration with the AvaTax service as soon as you have the following: a subscription to the AvaTax service ( http://www.avalara.com http://www.avalara.com), the license key and password to your organization's account in AvaTax, and the credentials (user name and password) to the AvaTax admin console. We recommend that you subscribe to the AvaTax Pro service, which has the features to meet most of your tax-related needs. It validates addresses, maintains up-to-date tax rates, stores customer exemption certificates, and files tax returns. In your AvaTax account, you should configure the company structure that corresponds to the structure of branches in Acumatica ERP, and configure the tax profile for each company in AvaTax (which corresponds to each Acumatica ERP branch). For more information, see To Configure Your AvaTax Account. Setup of Integration with AvaTax in Acumatica ERPTo set up the integration with the AvaTax service in Acumatica ERP, you should perform the following general tasks: Setting up the connection between your Acumatica ERP and AvaTax account. You also map each Acumatica ERP branch to the corresponding company that you have created in the AvaTax account for that branch. Setting up address verification. AvaTax uses address verification to determine the correct tax jurisdictions. Creating a dedicated tax agency account for use with AvaTax. Creating a tax zone associated with the tax agency you have created. Setting up the AvaTax tax codes (AvaTax uses hundreds of tax codes for products and services that are sold in the United States) as tax categories in one of the following ways: If your company's stock list includes many types of products, you can define all these tax codes as tax categories in Acumatica ERP by creating a tax category for each tax code. In this case, consider importing the needed tax codes by using an import scenario, which you can create on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206025|SM206025]) Import Scenarios (SM206025) form. If your company's stock list is small, use only the codes that apply to your company's products by creating the appropriate tax categories manually by using the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205500|TX205500]) Tax Categories (TX205500) form. If it is sufficient for your company to use the default tax category, create one tax category (for example, you can name it Taxable ) by using the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205500|TX205500]) Tax Categories (TX205500) form. In this case, you should create the corresponding tax code in your Avalara AvaTax account to associate it with the default tax category in Acumatica ERP. Configuring customers by specifying the Avalara tax zone for each required customer as the default tax zone. For each customer location with an effective tax exemption certificate, you should specify the number of this certificate and the default entity use code that provides the reasons for exemption. Configuring stock items and non-stock items by assigning them a special tax category that corresponds to the appropriate AvaTax tax code. If you are going to import stock item records from the source application you used before Acumatica ERP, consider adding to your import scenario the steps for assigning tax categories to the items. To facilitate assigning tax categories to stock items, you can use item classes, which are defined on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN201000|IN201000]) Item Classes (IN201000) form. Item classes provide settings for similar products, and most items in the class have the same tax category. Once you assign a tax category to an item class, all items (of this class) that you create later will have this tax category and other class settings by default. For instructions on configuring the integration with AvaTax, see To Set Up Integration With AvaTax. We recommend that you use tax calculation either by configuring integration with the AvaTax service, or by setting up the tax calculation process within Acumatica ERP (for details, see Setting Up Tax Calculation). Thus, you do not mix two tax calculation approaches in one system. Document Processing Once integration with AvaTax is configured and activated, documents are processed as follows: Individually, in real time, by using the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) and ([~/?ScreenId=SO303000|SO303000]) Invoices (SO303000) forms. Once a user takes a sales order or an invoice off hold, the system checks whether the customer location specified on the document is in the special ( AVALARA ) tax zone. If so, the system sends a request to AvaTax for processing the document. AvaTax determines the applicable taxes based on the customer location address, entity code, available exemption certificates, and tax rules (if any), and computes the tax amounts. AvaTax shows the tax IDs and tax amounts of the applicable taxes on the processed documents. In bulk, on schedule, by using the ([~/?ScreenId=AP501600|AP501600]) Calculate Taxes (AP501600), ([~/?ScreenId=CA501600|CA501600]) Calculate Taxes (CA501600), or ([~/?ScreenId=AR501600|AR501600]) Calculate Taxes (AR501600) forms. Each of these forms displays the documents (of particular types) for which taxes have not been calculated (for example, if the connection was not available). AvaTax processes the documents one by one, by calculating taxes and returning tax IDs and tax amounts. A user can initiate document processing manually or schedule it to be performed at night or any other convenient time. Taxes are calculated on sales orders only for informational purposes. Only taxes on invoices are actually reported. Avalara Tax Calculation in Accounts Receivable Invoices For sales tax calculation of an AR invoice, Acumatica ERP sends to Avalara the invoice amount and the information on two addresses used in Avalara: Address From and Address To . Address From is generally the address of the branch specified for the invoice as a whole—the one specified in the Branch box on the Financial Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form. If the invoice has been created from a service order or an appointment, Address From is the address of the warehouse (if applicable) specified for the line item, or the branch location address of the service order (if no warehouse is applicable). This address does not affect the sales tax calculation but is required in the Avalara API. Address To affects the tax calculation. In all existing versions of Acumatica ERP, the system uses the following sources of the addresses to send to Avalara for tax calculation of a particular document. Document Address To An accounts receivable invoice created on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos form, including an invoice that refers to a project (but excluding an invoice that refers to a service order or appointment) The main contact address that is specified for the customer account on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form An accounts receivable invoice created on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos form if the invoice that has been generated for a service order or appointment The address specified in the Address section on the Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders (FS300100) form for the related service order A pro forma invoice created on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM307000|PM307000]) Pro Forma Invoices (PM307000) form The main contact address that is specified for the customer account on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers form If you need the system to use different logic in retrieving Address To for sales tax calculation in documents, you can override the appropriate method through customization of Acumatica ERP. Tax Reporting By using the ([~/?ScreenId=TX501500|TX501500]) Post Taxes (TX501500) form, you can select the documents to be reflected on your tax reports. This form displays the list of released transactions for which AvaTax has calculated the taxes. You can post to your AvaTax account all the listed transactions or only those that you select, depending on the information you want AvaTax to use on the tax reports for your organization. Each posted document will have a copy in AvaTax. You can specify whether you want AvaTax to use the same sales accounts to store the transactions. To Configure Your AvaTax Account At this stage of integration configuration, you have to use the documentation provided by Avalara. We only briefly describe the general steps: Create an organizational structure that, in relation to taxes, is similar to the structure of branches in your organization in Acumatica ERP. To do this, use the parent company , child company and separate reporting entity properties for companies you create in AvaTax (which represent branches of your organization). Later you will associate each branch of your organization in Acumatica ERP with the corresponding company that you have created in AvaTax. Create a tax profile for each company (that is, each branch in Acumatica ERP). Select the states where each company has a nexus—that is, a significant business presence. Depending on your subscription level to AvaTax and the stage in initializing Acumatica ERP, either use AvaTax system tax codes or map your existing tax categories to AvaTax system tax codes (which is made on the Avalara website). Optional: Create and maintain tax rules—for example, define tax holidays for specific products for certain periods of time. AvaTax lets you gather information about customer exemption certificates and store it. ([~/?ScreenId=TX102000|TX102000]) ([~/?ScreenId=TX501500|TX501500])

==To Set Up the Connection Between Acumatica ERP and Your AvaTax Account==[anchor|#ol_bkn_cb4_bq] #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\TX_10_20_00|Tax Providers] ([~/?ScreenId=TX102000|TX102000]) form by searching for or navigating to it. #On the form toolbar, click '''Add New Record'''. #In the '''Provider ID''' box of the Summary area, type the identifier to be used for the provider. #In the '''Description''' box, enter a description of the provider. #In the '''Plug-In (Type)''' box, select the built-in Avalara plug-in. #Select the '''Active''' check box to activate the connection. #On the '''Plug-In Parameters''' tab, in the '''Value''' column for the ''Account Number'' parameter, type your account number in AvaTax. #In the '''Value''' column for the ''License Key'' parameter, type the license key your company uses for connecting to AvaTax. #In the '''Value''' column for the ''URL'' parameter, type the URL to be used to connect to AvaTax. #In the '''Value''' column for the ''Request Timeout (sec)'' parameter, type the number of seconds for the connection timeout. #In the '''Value''' column for the ''Send Sales Account'' and ''Check Address Before Calculating Tax'' parameters, select the check boxes; also, if required, in the '''Value''' column for the ''Inclusive Tax'' parameter, select the check box. #On the form toolbar, click '''Test Connection''' to test the connection. #:((({S:Hint}If the connection is successful, you will see a '''Test Connection''' message confirming the validity of your credentials. ))) #On the '''Company Code Mapping''' tab, click '''Add Row''' on the table toolbar to add a new row. #In the '''Branch''' column of the new row, select a branch by its ID to map it to the corresponding company that you have created in the AvaTax account. #In the '''Company Code''' column, type the company name that you have created in AvaTax for this branch. #Repeat Steps 13–15 for each branch. #Click '''Save'''.

To Set Up Integration With AvaTax To set up integration between Acumatica ERP and Avalara AvaTax, you need to do the following: Set up the connection on the ([~/?ScreenId=TX102000|TX102000]) Tax Providers (TX102000) form. Enable the Address Validation Integration feature on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form and configure address verification on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS204000|CS204000]) Countries/States (CS204000) form. Set up a tax agency to be used for the AvaTax integration on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form. Create a tax zone on the ([~/?ScreenId=TX206000|TX206000]) Tax Zones (TX206000) form that will be used with this special tax agency. Create tax categories to be associated with the AvaTax tax codes on the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205500|TX205500]) Tax Categories (TX205500) form. Specify appropriate settings for the customers on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form. Assign tax categories to stock items and non-stock items on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) and ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) forms. These subprocedures are described below. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. Before You Proceed Before you configure the integration with Avalara AvaTax in Acumatica ERP, make sure of the following: Your Avalara AvaTax account is configured. For details, see To Configure Your AvaTax Account. The External Tax Calculation Integration feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. To Set Up the Connection Between Acumatica ERP and Your AvaTax Account Open the ([~/?ScreenId=TX102000|TX102000]) Tax Providers (TX102000) form by searching for or navigating to it. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Provider ID box of the Summary area, type the identifier to be used for the provider. In the Description box, enter a description of the provider. In the Plug-In (Type) box, select the built-in Avalara plug-in. Select the Active check box to activate the connection. On the Plug-In Parameters tab, in the Value column for the Account Number parameter, type your account number in AvaTax. In the Value column for the License Key parameter, type the license key your company uses for connecting to AvaTax. In the Value column for the URL parameter, type the URL to be used to connect to AvaTax. In the Value column for the Request Timeout (sec) parameter, type the number of seconds for the connection timeout. In the Value column for the Send Sales Account and Check Address Before Calculating Tax parameters, select the check boxes; also, if required, in the Value column for the Inclusive Tax parameter, select the check box. On the form toolbar, click Test Connection to test the connection. If the connection is successful, you will see a Test Connection message confirming the validity of your credentials. On the Company Code Mapping tab, click Add Row on the table toolbar to add a new row. In the Branch column of the new row, select a branch by its ID to map it to the corresponding company that you have created in the AvaTax account. In the Company Code column, type the company name that you have created in AvaTax for this branch. Repeat Steps 13–15 for each branch. Click Save . To Set Up an Address Validation Provider Open the ([~/?ScreenId=CS103000|CS103000]) Address Validation Providers (CS103000) form by searching for or navigating to it. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Provider ID box, type the identifier to be used for the provider. In the Description box, enter the description of the provider. In the Plug-In (Type) box, select the built-in Avalara address validation plug-in. Select the Active check box to activate the connection. On the Plug-In Parameters tab, in the Value column for the Account Number parameter, type your account number in AvaTax. In the Value column for the License Key parameter, type the license key your company uses for connecting to AvaTax. In the Value column for the URL parameter, type the URL to be used to connect to AvaTax. In the Value column for the Request Timeout (sec) parameter, type the number of seconds for the connection timeout. On the form toolbar, click Test Connection to test the connection. If the connection is successful, you will see a Test Connection message confirming the validity of your credentials. Click Save . To Set Up Address Verification Open the ([~/?ScreenId=CS204000|CS204000]) Countries/States (CS204000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Country ID box of the Summary area, select US . In the Address Verification Plug-In box, select the Avalara address validation plug-in you set up in the previous subprocedure. Click Save . To Set Up a Tax Agency In Acumatica ERP, a tax agency is defined as a vendor. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form by searching for or navigating to it. In both the Vendor ID and Vendor Name boxes, type AVALARA (or another name that complies with the formatting rules defined by the VENDOR segmented key). On the General Info tab (in the Main Address section), in the Country box, enter US . In the Financial Settings section, in the Vendor Class box, select a vendor class that has been defined for tax agencies (if you have defined such a class) or any other appropriate class. In the Vendor Properties section, select the Vendor Is Tax Agency check box. (Notice that the Tax Agency Settings tab appears.) On the GL Accounts tab, specify the general ledger accounts and subaccounts that will be used for this vendor. Default accounts and subaccounts are displayed if they have been specified for the vendor class that you have selected on the General Info tab; however, you can select other accounts and subaccounts. Click Save . To Create the Needed Tax Zone Open the ([~/?ScreenId=TX206000|TX206000]) Tax Zones (TX206000) form by searching for or navigating to it. Type AVALARA in the Tax Zone ID box, and then type a description. Select the External Tax Provider check box; the Provider ID and Tax Agency ID boxes appear on the form. In the Provider ID box, select the Avalara tax provider. In the Tax Agency ID box, select the tax agency you created for this integration. Click Save . To Create Tax Categories for Tax Codes Open the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205500|TX205500]) Tax Categories (TX205500) form by searching for or navigating to it. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Tax Category ID box, type an AvaTax code, and in the Description box, provide a description. Click Save . Repeat Steps 2–4 for each required tax code. To Specify the Needed Settings for Each Customer Open the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form by searching for or navigating to it. Select a customer for which sales taxes should be calculated by AvaTax. Each customer has at least one automatically created location. On the Locations tab, click the link of one of the listed customer locations (or the only customer location, if only one is listed). On the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR303010|CR303010]) Account Locations (CR303010) form, which opens in a pop-up window, in the Tax Zone list, select Avalara . In the Tax Registration ID box, enter the customer's tax registration number. If this customer location is tax exempt, in the Tax Exemption Number box, enter the tax exemption number. In the Entity Usage Type box, select the option that corresponds to this location usage. On the form toolbar, click Save and Close . For each additional location, repeat Steps 4–8. To Assign Tax Categories to Each Stock Item or Non-Stock Items Open the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) or ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form by searching for or navigating to it. Select the stock or non-stock item by its inventory ID. On the General Settings tab, in the Tax Category box, select the appropriate tax category for the selected item. Click Save on the form toolbar.

row.PlainText: Configuring DeviceHub DeviceHub is a Windows application that is used for integrating with hardware devices, such as printers and digital scales. DeviceHub can be installed to run on a workstation or a server independently from a user session. (For more information, see To Install the Acumatica ERP Tools.) The Acumatica ERP Installer installs DeviceHub along with the instance if the Install DeviceHub check box has been selected in the list of Acumatica ERP tools to be installed. In this chapter, you can find information on how to configure DeviceHub for Acumatica ERP instance. In This Chapter To Set Up the Connection with DeviceHubTo Add Printers via DeviceHubTo Specify Default Printers for SelectionTo Configure Printer AccessTo Manage Print JobsTo Add a Scale in DeviceHubTo Specify the Current User's Default Scale

row.column: To Set Up the Connection with DeviceHub The DeviceHub application is a Windows application to which Acumatica ERP sends push notifications when a printing job is requested. To set up the connection between DeviceHub and Acumatica ERP instance, do the following: Navigate to Start > Programs > Acumatica > Acumatica DeviceHub to view the DeviceHub main window. In the application main menu, click File > Configure to open the Configuration window. (If you are running DeviceHub for the first time, the Configuration window opens automatically). On the Site tab, specify the following parameters: URL : The URL of the configured Acumatica ERP instance for which DeviceHub is configured (for example, ( http://localhost/AcumaticaDB ). Login : The user login that DeviceHub will use to connect to the Acumatica ERP instance. Password : The password that DeviceHub will use to connect to the Acumatica ERP instance. Tenant : The login name of the tenant to which DeviceHub will connect. DeviceHub is associated with a particular tenant in Acumatica ERP. For a multi-company configuration, the administrator needs to install and configure a separate DeviceHub for each company. Click OK . Sign in to the Acumatica ERP instance for which you have configured DeviceHub. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, click Modify on the form toolbar, and select the DeviceHub check box under the Monitoring & Automation group. On the form toolbar, click Enable .

To Add Printers via DeviceHub The DeviceHub application is a Windows application to which Acumatica ERP sends push notifications when a printing job is requested. To add a printer or multiple printers via DeviceHub, do the following: Navigate to Start > Programs > Acumatica > Acumatica DeviceHub to view the DeviceHub main window. Click File > Configure in the DeviceHub main menu. On the Printers tab, for each printer you want to add to the list, click the Add button, and specify the following settings: Name : Enter the name of the printer. Only digits and uppercase letters are allowed for printer names. If you specify an incorrect printer name, the system displays a message warning you that the printer name must be corrected. Printer : From the drop-down list, select one of the printers detected in the system. Raw Mode : Select this check box if the selected printer is to be used for printing labels. Paper Size : Leave <Printer Default> to use the default system settings, or specify another paper size. Paper Bin : Leave <Printer Default> to use the default system settings, or specify another paper bin. Orientation : Select the orientation to be used by default for this printer: Automatic , Portrait , or Landscape . Click OK to close the Configuration window. Sign in to the Acumatica ERP instance for which you have configured DeviceHub. On the System tab, click Management . In the left pane, navigate to Manage Printers (SM206510). On the form toolbar, click Update Printer List to retrieve the list of printers from DeviceHub. Refresh the form. ([~/?ScreenId=SM206510|SM206510])

To Specify Default Printers for Selection If the DeviceHub application is installed and configured, the system administrator can specify the various default printers so that the system will select the appropriate printer for users, branches, companies, and documents of particular modules. This topic provides detailed instructions on configuring all the default printers the system will use in this selection process. The system selects the printer for printing a particular document in the following order: The default printer specified for the currently signed-in user on the Printing Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form The default printer specified for the currently signed-in user in the Default Printer box on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form The default printer specified for the document to be printed on the Reporting Settings tab of the module preferences form or from which the document is sent for printing The default printer specified for the branch on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS102000|CS102000]) Branches (CS102000) form The default printer specified for the company on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form On each mass-processing form that provides a printing action, a user can select the Define Printer Manually check box and then specify the printer to be used instead of the default one. To Specify the Default Printer for a Report You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to specify the default printer for a particular report for printing initiated by the user account to which you are signed in. Before you proceed, you need to create a mailing assigned to the report on a preferences form that corresponds to the report functionality (for example, for purchasing-related reports, you create mailings on the Reporting Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form). Do the following: In the Info area, click your user name, and select My Profile . Open the Printing Settings tab. On the table toolbar, click Add Row . In the Mailing ID column, select the mailing that is assigned to the report. The system copies the report identifier from the mailing settings to the Report ID column automatically. In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default for printing the selected report. Make sure that the Active check box is selected. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for Printing a Carrier's Labels You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to specify the default printer for printing labels of a particular carrier initiated by the user account to which you are signed in to the system. Before you proceed, you need to create a mailing assigned to the report on a preferences form that corresponds to the report functionality (for example, for purchasing-related reports, you create mailings on the Reporting Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form). Proceed as follows: In the Info area, click your user name and select My Profile . Open the Printing Settings tab. On the table toolbar, click Add Row . In the Mailing ID column, select the mailing assigned to the report that is used for printing labels of the carrier. The system copies the report identifier from the mailing settings to the Report ID column automatically. In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default for printing the labels. In the Ship Via column, select the identifier of the carrier. Make sure that the Active check box is selected. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for the Current User You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to specify the default printer of a current user account. Proceed as follows: In the Info area, click your user name and select My Profile . In the Personal Settings section of the General Info tab, select the printer in the Default Printer box. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for a Document in the Accounts Payable Module You use the ([~/?ScreenId=AP101000|AP101000]) Accounts Payable Preferences (AP101000) form to specify the default printer to be used if documents are printed from the Accounts Payable module. Perform the following instructions: On the Finance tab, click Accounts Payable . In the left pane, navigate to Configuration Setup Accounts Payable Preferences (AP101000). On the Reporting Settings tab, do the following for the needed lines of the Default Sources table: In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default. The default printer can be selected for any print form of the module. Optional: In the Branch column, select the branch for which documents should be printed with the specified default printer. If a branch is not specified, the printer is used as the default for documents of all branches in this module. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for a Document in the Accounts Receivable Module You use the ([~/?ScreenId=AR101000|AR101000]) Accounts Receivable Preferences (AR101000) form to specify the default printer to be used if documents are printed from the Accounts Receivable module. Proceed as follows: On the Finance tab, click Accounts Receivable . In the left pane, navigate to Configuration Setup Accounts Receivable Preferences (AR101000). On the Reporting Settings tab, do the following for the needed lines of the Default Sources table: In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default. The default printer can be selected for any print form of the module. Optional: In the Branch column, select the branch for which documents should be printed with the specified default printer. If a branch is not specified, the printer is used as the default for documents of all branches in this module. Save your changes. Proceed as follows: On the Distribution tab, click Sales Orders . In the left pane, navigate to Configuration Setup Sales Orders Preferences (SO101000). On the Reporting Settings tab, do the following for the needed lines of the Default Sources table: In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default. The default printer can be selected for any print form of the module. Optional: In the Branch column, select the branch for which documents should be printed with the specified default printer. If a branch is not specified, the printer is used as the default for documents of all branches in this module. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for a Document in the Purchase Orders Module You use the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000) form to specify the default printer to be used if documents are printed from the Purchase Orders module. Perform the following instructions: On the Distribution tab, click Purchase Orders . In the left pane, navigate to Configuration Setup Purchase Orders Preferences (PO101000). On the Reporting Settings tab, do the following for the needed lines of the Default Sources table: In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default. The default printer can be selected for any print form of the module. Optional: In the Branch column, select the branch for which documents should be printed with the specified default printer. If a branch is not specified, the printer is used as the default for documents of all branches in this module. Save your changes. To Specify the Default Printer for a Document in the Purchase Requisitions Module You use the ([~/?ScreenId=RQ101000|RQ101000]) Purchase Requisitions Preferences (RQ101000) form to specify the default printer to be used if documents are printed from the Purchase Requisitions module. Proceed as follows: On the Distribution tab, click Purchase Requisitions . In the left pane, navigate to Configuration Setup Purchase Requisitions Preferences (RQ101000). On the Reporting Settings tab, do the following for the needed lines of the Default Sources table: In the Default Printer column, select the printer to be used by default. The default printer can be selected for any print form of the module. Optional: In the Branch column, select the branch for which documents should be printed with the specified default printer. If a branch is not specified, the printer is used as the default for documents of all branches in this module. Save your changes. To Specify a Default Printer for a Branch You use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS102000|CS102000]) Branches (CS102000) form to specify the default printer of a particular branch. Proceed as follows: On the Organization tab, click Organization Structure . In the left pane, navigate to Configure Branches (CS102000). In the Summary area, Branch ID box, select the branch for which you want to specify a default printer. In the Default Printer box, select the printer you want to specify as the default printer for the branch. Save your changes. To Specify a Default Printer for a Branch You use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS101500|CS101500]) Companies (CS101500) form to specify the default printer of a particular company. To Manage Print Jobs If the DeviceHub application is configured for use with the Acumatica ERP instance, the list of documents being sent for printing can be managed directly from Acumatica ERP, which sends push notifications to DeviceHub when a print job is requested. The following sections describe simple tasks that can be performed for print jobs on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206500|SM206500]) Print Jobs (SM206500) form. To Preview Print Jobs Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206500|SM206500]) Print Jobs (SM206500) form. In the Summary area of the form, specify the Start Date and End Date to define the date range for which you want to review print jobs. Optional: Clear the Hide Processed check box if you want to review all print jobs, including completed ones. In the table, select the unlabeled check boxes next to the print jobs you want to preview, and on the form toolbar, click Preview . To Reprint Print Jobs On the Configuration tab, click Document Management . In the left pane, navigate to Explore Print Jobs (SM206500). In the Summary area of the form, specify the Start Date and End Date to define the date range for which you want to review print jobs. Optional: Clear the Hide Processed check box, if you want to review and reprint completed print jobs. In the table, select the unlabeled check boxes next to the print jobs you want to reprint. Optional: In the Printer column,change the value for the needed print jobs to send them to another printer. On the form toolbar, click Reprint . ([~/?ScreenId=SM206500|SM206500])

In the '''Scale ID''' box, select the ID of the scale that you have configured, and verify the details.

To Add a Scale in DeviceHub If the DeviceHub application is installed and configured for use with the Acumatica ERP instance, a user can configure the digital scale device to be used in automated warehouse operations. The following instructions describe how to add a digital scale via DeviceHub. To Configure a Scale in DeviceHub Navigate to Start Programs Acumatica Acumatica DeviceHub to view the DeviceHub main window. Click File Configure on the DeviceHub main menu. On the Digital Scale tab, specify the settings as follows: Scale ID : Enter the ID of the digital scale. Only digits and uppercase letters are allowed for scale names. Device : From the drop-down list, select one of the digital scale devices detected in the system. Sign in to the Acumatica ERP instance for which you have configured DeviceHub. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206530|SM206530]) Scales (SM206510) form.
